elkfed.coref.algorithms.sieve

Class Sieve

  • java.lang.Object
    • elkfed.coref.algorithms.sieve.Sieve
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PreciseConstructSieve, PronounMatchSieve, ProperHeadNounMatchSieve, RelaxedHeadMatchSieve, RelaxedStringMatchSieve, SpeakerIdentificationSieve, StrictHeadMatchASieve, StrictHeadMatchBSieve, StrictHeadMatchCSieve, StringMatchSieve

    public abstract class Sieve
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract sieve class which provides utility methods and is inherited by all indiviual sieve classes
    Author:
    Xenia Kühling, Julian Baumann, Sebastian Ruder

      Checks if one mention is an acronym of the other mention and vice versa.
      (package private) boolean isAnimate(Mention mention)
      Checks if mention is animate Animacy is set using: (a) a static list for pronouns; (b) NER and Gender labels (e.g., PERSON and MALE are animate); and (c) lists of animate and inanimate unigrams taken from https://github.com/castiron/didh/tree/master/lib/vendor/snlp/dcoref; German lists have been translated using Google Translate.

      Checks if a mention and its antecedent are in an appositive construction.

      Check if one expression is a demonym of the other using a static list of countries and their gentilic forms taken from Wikipedia.

      Checks if mention and antecedent are in a role appositive construction.

      true if: this method tries to recognize all speakers that have speech to their left, e.g.: "
      boolean isSpeakerSpeechRight(Mention mention)
      true if: this method tries to recognize all speakers that have speech to their right, e.g.: A: "..."

      Check whether two mentions are in an i-within-i relation (Chomsky, 1981).

      Check if mention and antecedent belong to the same semantic class or mention's or antecedent's semantic class equals "unknown".

      Check if modifiers of the pair do not contain different location named entities, other proper nouns or spatial modifiers.

      Check if antecendent or mention do not contain a number that the other one does not contain.

      Check if mention and antecedent have the same number (plural / singular) or mention's or antecedent's number equals "unknown".

      Check if both mention and antecedent are proper names and have the same semantic class.

      Returns true if the mention head matches any word in the antecedent entity.

      Abstract method that uses the particular rules of a sieve to look for an antecedent for a mention in the list of mentions that was provided to the sieve.

      Compute if sentences in which mention and antecedent appear are not more than 4 sentences apart.

      Returns true if every word in the mention is contained in the antecedent entity.

    • Method Detail

      • runSieve

        abstract int runSieve(Mention mention)
        Abstract method that uses the particular rules of a sieve to look for an antecedent for a mention in the list of mentions that was provided to the sieve.
        Parameters:
        mention - the mention whose antecedent is sought
        Returns:
        index of antecedent; -1 if no antecedent is found

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns sieve name
        Returns:
        name of the sieve

      • isAppositive

        boolean isAppositive(elkfed.coref.PairInstance pair)
        Checks if a mention and its antecedent are in an appositive construction.

        Note: Appositive constructions are not annotated in TüBa-D/Z.

        Parameters:
        pair - PairInstance of mention, antecedent
        Returns:
        true or false

      • isPredicateNominative

        boolean isPredicateNominative(elkfed.coref.PairInstance pair)
        Checks if mention and antecedent are in a copulative subject-object relation. These are almost never annotated.
        Parameters:
        pair - PairInstance of mention, antecedent
        Returns:
        true or false

      • isRoleAppositive

        boolean isRoleAppositive(elkfed.coref.PairInstance pair)
        Checks if mention and antecedent are in a role appositive construction.

        Note: Role appositive constructions are not annotated in TüBa-D/Z.

        Parameters:
        pair - PairInstance of mention, antecedent
        Returns:
        true or false

      • isAnimate

        boolean isAnimate(Mention mention)
        Checks if mention is animate

        Animacy is set using: (a) a static list for pronouns; (b) NER and Gender labels (e.g., PERSON and MALE are animate); and (c) lists of animate and inanimate unigrams taken from https://github.com/castiron/didh/tree/master/lib/vendor/snlp/dcoref; German lists have been translated using Google Translate.

        Parameters:
        mention - the mention whose animacy should be checked
        Returns:
        true or false

      • isNeutral

        boolean isNeutral(Mention mention)
        Checks if mention is neutral.

        Uses NER and Gender labels, and male, female, and neutral lists taken from https://github.com/castiron/didh/tree/master/lib/vendor/snlp/dcoref; German lists have been translated using Google Translate.

        Parameters:
        mention - a mention
        Returns:
        true or false

      • isRelativePronoun

        boolean isRelativePronoun(elkfed.coref.PairInstance pair)
        Checks if the mention is a relative pronoun and modifies the antecedent.
        Parameters:
        pair - PairInstance of mention, antecedent
        Returns:
        true or false

        boolean isAcronym(elkfed.coref.PairInstance pair)
        Checks if one mention is an acronym of the other mention and vice versa.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true or false;

                         Mention expression)
        Checks if one string is an acronym of the other string.
        Parameters:
        acronym - the acronym mention
        expression - the mention whose initials could form said acronym
        Returns:
        true or false

        Check if one expression is a demonym of the other using a static list of countries and their gentilic forms taken from Wikipedia.

        Returns:
        true or false

      • IWithinI

        boolean IWithinI(elkfed.coref.PairInstance pair)
        Check whether two mentions are in an i-within-i relation (Chomsky, 1981).
        Parameters:
        pair - PairInstance of mention, antecedent
        Returns:
        true if in such a relation; false if not

      • noNumericMismatch

        public boolean noNumericMismatch(elkfed.coref.PairInstance pair)
        Check if antecendent or mention do not contain a number that the other one does not contain.
        Parameters:
        pair - PairInstance of mention, antecedent
        Returns:
        true if no numeric mismatch, otherwise false

        pair - PairInstance of mention, antecedent
        Returns:
        true if no location mismatch , otherwise false

        Returns:
        true if head matches; false if not

      • properNameAgreement

        public boolean properNameAgreement(elkfed.coref.PairInstance pair)
        Check if both mention and antecedent are proper names and have the same semantic class.
        Parameters:
        pair - PairInstance of mention, antecedent
        Returns:
        true if proper names agree; false if not

      • isSpeakerSpeechLeft

        public boolean isSpeakerSpeechLeft(Mention mention)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • isSpeakerSpeechRight

        public boolean isSpeakerSpeechRight(Mention mention)

        Parameters:
        mention -
        Returns:
        true or false
